H

HapticEvent - Class in com.uce.userlab.haptics.event
This representes Events within a haptic device, it is passed when listener methods are called.
HapticEvent(Object, String, int) - Constructor for class com.uce.userlab.haptics.event.HapticEvent
Creates a new HapticEvent object to be passed in event calls
HapticEvent(Object, String, int, double[], int) - Constructor for class com.uce.userlab.haptics.event.HapticEvent
Creates a new HapticEvent object to be passed in event calls
HapticListener - Interface in com.uce.userlab.haptics.event
This interface lays out the methods that a haptic Device listener must have to listen to any haptic Device, there are methods for regualar update calls updates, inputs and event interal errors so that a listener is always kept informed about the state inwhich the haptic Device is in.
HapticListenerSupport - Class in com.uce.userlab.haptics.event
This supports Device implimentations with managing listeners and firing events to those Haptics Listeners.
HapticListenerSupport(Object) - Constructor for class com.uce.userlab.haptics.event.HapticListenerSupport
Creates a new HapticListenerSupport object for a give source object

HDAPI - Class in com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD
This Class is the Java Implementation of OpenHaptics API HDAPI, this class is includes all the methods needed to manage and use the device.
HDAPI() - Constructor for class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD.HDAPI
 
hdBeginFrame(int) - Static method in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD.HDAPI
Begins an haptic frame, this opens a block of code that guarantee consistance
HDCallback - Interface in com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD
This interface layout the contract for a Objects that wish to recieve callbacks from HDAPI Haptic device.

hdEndFrame(int) - Static method in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD.HDAPI

HDException - Exception in com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD
This Class is for representing exception thrown by the HD API haptic device interface, this exception encapsulate everything that is given in the errors within c/c++ HD API by OpenHaptics toolkit.

HL_COLLISION_THREAD - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
This will indicate that the Callback method will be called from the internal collision thread
HL_CONSTRAINT - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Set a surface (geometric primitives) not to allow the proxy off the surface, it will only be allowed to move off the surface if device position from surface is greater than snap distance
HL_CONTACT - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Set a surface (geometric primitives) not to allow the proxy to pass though it, it may move off the surface but must stay one side of it
HL_DAMPING - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Allows damping to be controlled, this will reduce the springiness of surfaces.
HL_DEVICE_FORCE - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Gets Vector of 3 doubles representing the last force, in world co-ordinates, sent to the haptic device
HL_DEVICE_POSITION - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Gets a Vector of 3 doubles representing the position of the haptics device in world co-ordinates
HL_DEVICE_ROTATION - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Gets a Vector of 4 doubles representing a quaternion that specifies the rotation of the haptic device in world co-ordinates
HL_DEVICE_TORQUE - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Gets Vector of 3 doubles representing the last torque, in world co-ordinates, sent to the haptic device
HL_DEVICE_TRANSFORM - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Gets Vector 16 doubles representing a 4x4 transform matrix in column major order that specifies the transform of the haptic device relative to world co-ordinates
HL_DYNAMIC_FRICTION - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Allows dynamic friction to be controlled, this will effect the resistance a surface gives once movement is has started along the surface.
HL_EFFECT_CALLBACK - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI

HL_EFFECT_CONSTANT - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Adds a constant force vector to the total force sent to the haptic device
HL_EFFECT_FRICTION - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Adds a friction force to the total force sent to the hatic device, this friction is for both when touching objects and when in free space
HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_DIRECTION - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
This property is used by constant effect.

This property is used by constant, spring, friction and viscous effect types.
HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_POSITION - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
This property is used by spring effect.
HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_TYPE - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI

HL_EFFECT_SPRING - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Adds a spring force to the total force sent to the haptic device, this force will pull the proxy towards event point
HL_EFFECT_START - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Indicates the start of an effect definition or excution
HL_EFFECT_STOP - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Indicates the end of a effect excution or definition
HL_EFFECT_VISCOUS - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Adds a viscous force to the total force sent to the haptic device, this force will apply resistance according to the velocity of the haptic device

HL_EVENT_MOTION_LINEAR_TOLERANCE - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI

Sets the Event Callback to occure for any object within a scene
HL_PROXY_IS_TOUCHING - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI
Gets a singel boolean value indicating weather the proxy is in contact with a shape

HL_STIFFNESS - Static variable in class com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI

HLAPI - Class in com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL
This Class is the Java Implementation of OpenHaptics API HLAPI, this class is includes all the methods needed to bind to OpenGL (JOGL).
